segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 10
segments.en: Numbered Discourses 10

segments.pli: 7. Yamakavagga
segments.en: 7. Pairs

segments.pli: 70. Dutiyakathāvatthusutta
segments.en: 70. Topics of Discussion (2nd)

segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.

segments.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sambahulā bhikkhū pacchābhattaṃ piṇḍapātapaṭikkantā upaṭṭhānasālāyaṃ sannisinnā sannipatitā anekavihitaṃ tiracchānakathaṃ anuyuttā viharanti, seyyathidaṃ—
segments.en: Now at that time, after the meal, on return from alms-round, several mendicants sat together in the meeting hall.

segments.pli: rājakathaṃ corakathaṃ mahāmattakathaṃ … pe … itibhavābhavakathaṃ iti vāti.
segments.en: They engaged in all kinds of unworthy talk, such as talk about kings, bandits, and ministers; talk about armies, threats, and wars; talk about food, drink, clothes, and beds; talk about garlands and fragrances; talk about family, vehicles, villages, towns, cities, and nations; talk about women and heroes; street talk and well talk; talk about the departed; miscellaneous talk; tales of land and sea; and talk about being reborn in this or that state of existence.

segments.pli: “Dasayimāni, bhikkhave, pāsaṃsāni ṭhānāni.
segments.en: “Mendicants, there are ten grounds for praise.

segments.pli: Katamāni dasa?
segments.en: What ten?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu attanā ca appiccho hoti, appicchakathañca bhikkhūnaṃ kattā hoti.
segments.en: It’s when a mendicant personally has few wishes, and speaks to the mendicants on having few wishes.

segments.pli: ‘Appiccho bhikkhu appicchakathañca bhikkhūnaṃ kattā’ti pāsaṃsametaṃ ṭhānaṃ. (1)
segments.en: This is a ground for praise.

segments.pli: Attanā ca santuṭṭho hoti, santuṭṭhikathañca bhikkhūnaṃ kattā hoti.
segments.en: A mendicant personally is content, and speaks to the mendicants on contentment.

segments.pli: ‘Santuṭṭho bhikkhu santuṭṭhikathañca bhikkhūnaṃ kattā’ti pāsaṃsametaṃ ṭhānaṃ. (2)
segments.en: This is a ground for praise.

segments.pli: Attanā ca pavivitto hoti, pavivekakathañca bhikkhūnaṃ kattā hoti.
segments.en: A mendicant personally is secluded, and speaks to the mendicants on seclusion.

segments.pli: ‘Pavivitto bhikkhu pavivekakathañca bhikkhūnaṃ kattā’ti pāsaṃsametaṃ ṭhānaṃ. (3)
segments.en: This is a ground for praise.

segments.pli: Attanā ca asaṃsaṭṭho hoti, asaṃsaṭṭhakathañca bhikkhūnaṃ kattā hoti.
segments.en: A mendicant personally doesn’t mix closely with others, and speaks to the mendicants on not mixing closely with others.

segments.pli: ‘Asaṃsaṭṭho bhikkhu asaṃsaṭṭhakathañca bhikkhūnaṃ kattā’ti pāsaṃsametaṃ ṭhānaṃ. (4)
segments.en: This is a ground for praise.

segments.pli: Attanā ca āraddhavīriyo hoti, vīriyārambhakathañca bhikkhūnaṃ kattā hoti.
segments.en: A mendicant personally is energetic, and speaks to the mendicants on being energetic.

segments.pli: ‘Āraddhavīriyo bhikkhu vīriyārambhakathañca bhikkhūnaṃ kattā’ti pāsaṃsametaṃ ṭhānaṃ. (5)
segments.en: This is a ground for praise.

segments.pli: Attanā ca sīlasampanno hoti, sīlasampadākathañca bhikkhūnaṃ kattā hoti.
segments.en: A mendicant personally is accomplished in ethics, and speaks to the mendicants on being accomplished in ethics.

segments.pli: ‘Sīlasampanno bhikkhu sīlasampadākathañca bhikkhūnaṃ kattā’ti pāsaṃsametaṃ ṭhānaṃ. (6)
segments.en: This is a ground for praise.

segments.pli: Attanā ca samādhisampanno hoti, samādhisampadākathañca bhikkhūnaṃ kattā hoti.
segments.en: A mendicant personally is accomplished in immersion, and speaks to the mendicants on being accomplished in immersion.

segments.pli: ‘Samādhisampanno bhikkhu samādhisampadākathañca bhikkhūnaṃ kattā’ti pāsaṃsametaṃ ṭhānaṃ. (7)
segments.en: This is a ground for praise.

segments.pli: Attanā ca paññāsampanno hoti, paññāsampadākathañca bhikkhūnaṃ kattā hoti.
segments.en: A mendicant personally is accomplished in wisdom, and speaks to the mendicants on being accomplished in wisdom.

segments.pli: ‘Paññāsampanno bhikkhu paññāsampadākathañca bhikkhūnaṃ kattā’ti pāsaṃsametaṃ ṭhānaṃ. (8)
segments.en: This is a ground for praise.

segments.pli: Attanā ca vimuttisampanno hoti, vimuttisampadākathañca bhikkhūnaṃ kattā hoti.
segments.en: A mendicant personally is accomplished in freedom, and speaks to the mendicants on being accomplished in freedom.

segments.pli: ‘Vimuttisampanno bhikkhu vimuttisampadākathañca bhikkhūnaṃ kattā’ti pāsaṃsametaṃ ṭhānaṃ. (9)
segments.en: This is a ground for praise.

segments.pli: Attanā ca vimuttiñāṇadassanasampanno hoti, vimuttiñāṇadassanasampadākathañca bhikkhūnaṃ kattā hoti.
segments.en: A mendicant personally is accomplished in the knowledge and vision of freedom, and speaks to the mendicants on being accomplished in the knowledge and vision of freedom.

segments.pli: ‘Vimuttiñāṇadassanasampanno bhikkhu vimuttiñāṇadassanasampadākathañca bhikkhūnaṃ kattā’ti pāsaṃsametaṃ ṭhānaṃ. (10)
segments.en: This is a ground for praise.

segments.pli: Imāni kho, bhikkhave, dasa pāsaṃsāni ṭhānānī”ti.
segments.en: These are the ten grounds for praise.”

segments.pli: Dasamaṃ.
Yamakavaggo dutiyo.
Avijjā taṇhā niṭṭhā ca,
avecca dve sukhāni ca;
Naḷakapāne dve vuttā,
kathāvatthūpare duveti.

sections.title: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī…

suttaplex.blurb: The monks are sitting around chatting about this and that. The Buddha admonishes them and teaches ten grounds of praise.
